                <sections>
                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c0daa88c2bc75a129a533a00da453bf8" id="tgt939" class="tgtSentence">Dropdownlisten im Suchfeld\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d0ffb3047e930aac6713ee3959cd65f0" id="tgt940" class="tgtSentence">Das Dropdownmenü im Suchfeld kann etwas komplexer sein als andere Dropdownmenüs in Visual Studio.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="430161ea60d2b31cb46e4e5ff0a269f1" id="tgt941" class="tgtSentence"> Die Bereiche "Empfohlene Suchbegriffe" und "Suchoptionen" können alleine oder zusammen im Menü erscheinen, und jedem Bereich kann eine eigene Farbe zugeordnet sein.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b752480e006135cb89527685bc814002" id="tgt942" class="tgtSentence"> Die beiden Bereiche werden außerdem durch eine Linie getrennt, wenn sie zusammen auftreten, und das gesamte Dropdownmenü ist von einem Rahmen umgeben.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="a19d3777-32df-4c59-97ff-1186363d968a"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt943" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="1e7455d5ef374ce559b9999dccc3c4df" id="tgt944" class="tgtSentence">für die Erstellung einer benutzerdefinierten Dropdownliste im Suchfeld\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b940d14f22d91a10c60199cb28637f66" id="tgt945" class="tgtSentence">bei Verwendung der richtigen Tokennamen für die entsprechenden Listenkomponenten\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt946" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="a5a478aa6af93b28c84ec2def706b888" id="tgt947" class="tgtSentence">für Dropdownlisten, die in anderen Kontexten angezeigt werden\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0f6811b05660fde57651fda214919653" id="tgt1001" class="tgtSentence">Link\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c88ca49653b9f795d67d260c871460bf" id="tgt1002" class="tgtSentence">Der Link ist ein Steuerelement, das keine Kombination aus Vordergrund-/Hintergrundfarbe darstellt.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="f6719dc4f32b67c142f3f59f30852cef" id="tgt1003" class="tgtSentence"> Sie verwenden grundsätzlich die Vordergrund-Linkfarbe, die auf dunklem, grauen und weißem Hintergrund ordnungsgemäß angezeigt wird.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="db7983803c995ab6337aa86e5352a2e9" id="tgt1004" class="tgtSentence"> Wenn Sie nicht das Farbtoken für das Linksteuerelement verwenden, sehen Sie für den "gedrückten" Zustand die Standardsystemfarbe, die rot blinkend dargestellt wird.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="e01e059443a5530acb09866758481f6c" id="tgt1005" class="tgtSentence"> Das ist das Signal, dass das Steuerelement nicht das richtige Farbtoken für die Umgebung verwendet.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="e0f799a4-a0b0-45c6-983a-1a32a05d5442"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1006" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b2bcc8398aacb900e59e8711a8023f32" id="tgt1007" class="tgtSentence">für die Erstellung eines benutzerdefinierten Links\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1008" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="848339432500b326d6b08d947419f933" id="tgt1009" class="tgtSentence">für Elemente, die keinen Link darstellen\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <para>
                    <br />
                  </para>
                  <para>
                    <legacyBold>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c21f969b5f03d33d43e04f8f136e7682" id="tgt1010" class="tgtSentence">Standard\</caps:sentence>
                    </legacyBold>
                  </para>
                  <table>
                    <thead>
                      <tr>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="700c216fb376666eaeda0c892e8bdc09" id="tgt1011" class="tgtSentence">Komponente\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="8e2dcfd7e7e24b1ca76c1193f645902b" id="tgt1012" class="tgtSentence">Element\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0b543509aafdb4a74686fb3c28516d75" id="tgt1013" class="tgtSentence">Tokenname: Category.color\</caps:sentence>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="983e9056ba263a8f8d945354a35c8e0f" id="tgt1030" class="tgtSentence">Infoleiste\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d1e8c0cd0c774307dd650b08ff9c7b60" id="tgt1031" class="tgtSentence">Infoleisten werden verwendet, um weitere Informationen zu einem bestimmten Kontext bereitzustellen. Sie erscheinen immer im oberen Bereich eines Dokument- oder Toolfensters.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="9ee3f809-df03-4a90-9e2c-0762dbeac61c"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1032" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="f8cb70b9a225c14b649246c6aa9d2473" id="tgt1033" class="tgtSentence">für die Erstellung einer benutzerdefinierten Infoleiste\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1034" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="4e3e1fbafb0ad89e5284b87fe399872e" id="tgt1035" class="tgtSentence">für Benutzeroberflächenelemente, die keine Ähnlichkeit mit einer Infoleiste haben\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <table>
                    <thead>
                      <tr>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="700c216fb376666eaeda0c892e8bdc09" id="tgt1036" class="tgtSentence">Komponente\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="8e2dcfd7e7e24b1ca76c1193f645902b" id="tgt1037" class="tgtSentence">Element\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0b543509aafdb4a74686fb3c28516d75" id="tgt1038" class="tgtSentence">Tokenname: Category.color\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                      </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <TD rowspan="3">

                          </mediaLink>

                            <embeddedLabel>

                            </embeddedLabel>
                          </para>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="36f73c8de180d97e0f5e4e6c421f3210" id="tgt1043" class="tgtSentence">Bildlaufleiste\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0a22ae9761208897f58ff377613905ab" id="tgt1044" class="tgtSentence">Bildlaufleisten erhalten ihr Format von der Visual Studio-Umgebung, sodass kein Design angewendet werden muss.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="ddeab77e9a604090e4691ffa19452b8a" id="tgt1045" class="tgtSentence"> Sie können jedoch festlegen, dass die in Bildlaufleisten genutzten Farben verwendet werden, damit Ihre Benutzeroberfläche immer mit diesem Teil der Visual Studio-Umgebung konsistent ist.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="de1243fc-e076-49c5-9e97-7c8a5a97ae65"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1046" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="698d299d321156dba6ede3df22f16ebc" id="tgt1047" class="tgtSentence">für die Erstellung einer Benutzeroberfläche, die auf die Visual Studio-Bildlaufleisten abgestimmt sein soll.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="e7d4308c781898da071508a50ac1efd3" id="tgt1048" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0d011f305307b171a6a8990044c8f76c" id="tgt1049" class="tgtSentence">für Elemente, die nicht grundsätzlich auf die Bildlaufleisten-Benutzeroberfläche abgestimmt sein sollen\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <para>
                    <br />
                  </para>
                  <para>
                    <legacyBold>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c21f969b5f03d33d43e04f8f136e7682" id="tgt1050" class="tgtSentence">Standard\</caps:sentence>
                    </legacyBold>
                  </para>

              <section address="BKMK_TreeView">
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="93ec2a442478bb40ce3cd223279ffac3" id="tgt1083" class="tgtSentence">Strukturansicht\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c2de2e73855a6ddb84206e182d76e2e7" id="tgt1084" class="tgtSentence">Mehrere Toolfenster, einschließlich Projektmappen-Explorer, Server-Explorer und Klassenansicht, implementieren ein hierarchisches Organisationsschema, dessen Farben über Farbnamen in der TreeView-Kategorie gesteuert werden.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c57808fbe1946fffd08960375572b19a" id="tgt1085" class="tgtSentence"> Alle Elemente in einer Strukturansicht haben Hintergrund- und Textfarben.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="5ef0a0a859b94a153585fedd2ae492f6" id="tgt1086" class="tgtSentence"> Elemente mit geschachtelten untergeordneten Elementen verfügen außerdem über Glyphen, die anzeigen, ob das Element erweitert oder reduziert ist.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="cd3f4f66-0490-443d-a1af-6a9a455c293c"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1087" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="aacd13c3ebfe38d80f04be1adcc2cb55" id="tgt1088" class="tgtSentence">für alle Projekte zur Implementierung einer hierarchischen Organisationsstruktur\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1089" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="93697aeff30620687335003b63c577d6" id="tgt1090" class="tgtSentence">für Elemente, die keine Ähnlichkeit mit einer Strukturansicht haben\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="19c0a2b94938cbbd065df32a0551cbdd" id="tgt1091" class="tgtSentence">für eine andere als die angegebene Kombination aus Hintergrund-/Vordergrundfarbe\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <para>
                    <br />
                  </para>
                  <para>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="a9cbe62cf001901dd487bf35430f90d0" id="tgt1230" class="tgtSentence">Dropdownlisten-/Kombinationsfeld-Steuerelement\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="89a28b40-e73f-4805-b923-a34b57cce593"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1231" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="24050d72c736730343cf6e672b4f1297" id="tgt1232" class="tgtSentence">für Dropdownlisten und Kombinationsfelder, die Teil des Dokumentursprungs sind.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1233" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="a706232c31797b214f8425e450a3125e" id="tgt1234" class="tgtSentence">für Benutzeroberflächenelemente, die keine Dropdownliste und kein Kombinationsfeld sind\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="6add44f1e7941ca79e1832a40a9977a0" id="tgt1235" class="tgtSentence">für eine \<link xlink:href="9d3186f3-07d2-441f-b33e-435e95d8a0b8#BKMK_CommandDropDown">Drop-down</link> oder ein \<link xlink:href="9d3186f3-07d2-441f-b33e-435e95d8a0b8#BKMK_CommandComboBox">Combo box</link> in der Befehlsleiste\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <para>
                    <br />
                  </para>
                  <para>
                    <legacyBold>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="566f9d4d1a0fa59c2023a4ee8f3256f9" id="tgt1296" class="tgtSentence">Tabellendaten-Steuerelemente (Raster)\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b27ff40a9c6168fa5cd2d59a57cabd8f" id="tgt1297" class="tgtSentence">Tabellendaten-Steuerelemente, die auch als Rastersteuerelemente bezeichnet werden. Dies sind gebräuchliche Steuerelemente in Visual Studio, die werden verwendet, um große Datenmengen in mehreren Spalten darzustellen.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="827a031eef125982468579799add6cfd" id="tgt1298" class="tgtSentence"> Standardmäßige Tabellendaten-Steuerelemente sind in Visual Studio an mehreren Orten zu finden: z. a. in Fehlerlisten-Toolfenstern, IntelliTrace-Berichte und Speicherheapansichten.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="3aeae7e981bc5dc7283648808adacb5e" id="tgt1299" class="tgtSentence"> Verwenden Sie immer die standardmäßig bereitgestellten Tabellendaten-Steuerelemente.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="5cc41d1f805bdc6bc4107d8022c6173b" id="tgt1300" class="tgtSentence"> In einigen seltenen Fällen haben Sie jedoch möglicherweise keinen Zugriff auf die standardmäßigen Tabellendaten-Steuerelemente.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="05f6f5dde9c6a68d092cdd22f62cb55b" id="tgt1301" class="tgtSentence"> Verwenden Sie in dieser Situation die folgenden Tokennamen, um sicherzustellen, dass die Benutzeroberfläche mit anderen Tabellendaten-Steuerelementen in Visual Studio konsistent ist.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="de4f8596-354a-4ce2-a4ad-bce5bbcf1ce5"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1302" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="4d53758c8d13229b65269fbd312898f5" id="tgt1303" class="tgtSentence">für Tabellen- oder Rastersteuerelemente\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1304" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="ce877d5b0edbc89454d3d59a9322dc15" id="tgt1305" class="tgtSentence">für Benutzeroberflächenelemente, die kein Tabellen- oder Rastersteuerelement sind\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                </content>
                <sections>
                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c66f583c69ad3aff181125a698ef777a" id="tgt1306" class="tgtSentence">Spaltenheader\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="127b0354581e18a4eb933f362e00a98b" id="tgt1307" class="tgtSentence">Spaltenheader setzen sich aus Hintergrund, Rahmen, Titeltext und einer optionalen Glyphe zusammen, die normalerweise verwendet wird, wenn ein Raster nach dieser Spalte sortiert wird.\</caps:sentence>

                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="5b6aa66d6c5d1546b574d08ae5f72911" id="tgt1326" class="tgtSentence">Listenansichtselemente\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="1f9a2312ae69da1b6c80ad5255d76659" id="tgt1327" class="tgtSentence">Listenansichtselemente bestehen aus einem Hintergrund und dem Inhalt.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="7a61078b9c4cbd72343ff6ca4781f034" id="tgt1328" class="tgtSentence"> Der Inhalt kann Text, ein Symbol oder beides sein.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <table>
                        <thead>
                          <tr>
                            <TD>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="9ed39e2ea931586b6a985a6942ef573e" id="tgt1329" class="tgtSentence">Zustand\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </TD>

                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                          <tr>
                            <TD rowspan="3">

                              </para>
                            </TD>

                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                          <tr>

                          <tr>

          <section>
            <title>
              \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d1c22c5a91151af83705e09a3635c568" id="tgt1348" class="tgtSentence">Manifest-Designer\</caps:sentence>
            </title>
            <content>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="eb921629348d79b7d1bc03e2a6d9bb82" id="tgt1349" class="tgtSentence">Der Manifest-Designer dient dazu, die Bearbeitung der Manifestdatei in Windows 8- und Windows Phone 8-Projekten zu vereinfachen.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="bc7d389a083f4833dbf938ba1aed3aad" id="tgt1350" class="tgtSentence"> Obwohl es kein gemeinsames Framework gibt, kann es von Vorteil sein, das Entwurfslayout und die Farben von Ausrichtungs-/Navigationsregisterkarten und Gesamtstruktur aufeinander abzustimmen.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="78665cd2083afe2cadd6ef32e622ec68" id="tgt1351" class="tgtSentence"> Weitere Informationen zu Layoutdetails finden Sie unter \<link xlink:href="c19e3022-047c-43b6-a046-a82717efed4f">Layout for Visual Studio</link>.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
              <mediaLink>
                \<image xlink:href="6bb5cdec-651d-42af-8649-93374ac1056e"></image>
              </mediaLink>
              <definitionTable>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1352" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <list class="bullet">
                    <listItem>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="4a53746ef1613f83e533de6ee2a26f42" id="tgt1353" class="tgtSentence">für Designer, die Ähnlichkeit mit dem Manifest-Designer haben.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </listItem>
                    <listItem>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="e725c4730564fb13ab7304888f293775" id="tgt1354" class="tgtSentence">anstelle allgemeiner Registerkarten-Steuerelemente, die im oberen Bereich eines Editors im Dokumentursprung angezeigt werden.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </listItem>
                  </list>
                </definition>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1355" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <list class="bullet">
                    <listItem>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="acb9d0a7ee34abc1b403aa6ad89cf557" id="tgt1356" class="tgtSentence">bei Verwendung von mehr als sechs Registerkarten\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </listItem>
                    <listItem>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="4613efd28e7d7a8f00e314f0cffed608" id="tgt1357" class="tgtSentence">für Benutzeroberflächenelemente, die nicht wie der Manifest-Designer aufgebaut sind\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </listItem>
                  </list>
                </definition>
              </definitionTable>

                <thead>

          <section>
            <title>
              \<caps:sentence sentenceid="7083a19806d3d0e94bb134eb9cec3403" id="tgt1379" class="tgtSentence">Tagging\</caps:sentence>
            </title>
            <content>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="e211390f6067b7564af57d811de3c683" id="tgt1380" class="tgtSentence">Visual Studio unterstützt Tags, mit deren Hilfe ein Benutzer suchbare Schlüsselwörter für Nachverfolgungszwecke deklarieren kann.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="7dca1dd3e4f1c22af4e4a9d3d9864467" id="tgt1381" class="tgtSentence"> Projektleiter und Entwickler können beispielsweise Team Foundation Server (TFS) verwenden, um Arbeitselemente zu kennzeichnen.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="1c1a0f303de377fea15fd6c1c4d33b83" id="tgt1382" class="tgtSentence"> Die folgenden Tabellen enthalten Farbnamen sowohl für das Tag selbst als auch für die Glyphe "Schließsymbol", die im Zustand "Darauf zeigen" und "Ausgewählt" angezeigt wird.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
              <mediaLink>
                \<image xlink:href="246e4206-e877-4433-9a48-faf01b1e35bd"></image>
              </mediaLink>
              <definitionTable>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1383" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="77d3b4d7b917d54b903c4c722b017ff1" id="tgt1384" class="tgtSentence">für Benutzeroberflächen, die Tags unterstützen.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                </definition>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1385" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="9fe5256397d8a4ad825e644e4f3e58ac" id="tgt1386" class="tgtSentence">für andere Arten von Benutzeroberflächenelementen\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                </definition>
              </definitionTable>
            </content>
            <sections>

            <sections>
              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d229bbf31eaeebc7c88897732d8b932d" id="tgt1453" class="tgtSentence">Hintergrund\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="cd7e5fa7dc7906d4f39ed23cfd7468c4" id="tgt1454" class="tgtSentence">Der Umgebungshintergrund setzt sich aus zwei Ebenen zusammen.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="89d380f13ab5b03d35b4c211ccb17b04" id="tgt1455" class="tgtSentence"> Die untere Ebene ist eine Volltonfarbe, die die gesamte IDE abdeckt.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="5d233b8b49e9441f747d96952db98071" id="tgt1456" class="tgtSentence"> Die obere Ebene befindet sich unterhalb der Befehlsablage und zwischen den automatisch ausgeblendeten Kanälen des Toolfensters am linken und rechten Rand der IDE.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b36de6168d0e4dda7505804466258b0a" id="tgt1457" class="tgtSentence"> Ab Visual Studio 2013 werden die obere und untere Hintergrundebene im dunklen und hellen Design auf dieselbe Farbe festgelegt.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="6d773dae-d7c2-40ca-aec7-be07771aec59"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1458" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="13f07ef675be6a49c48d53ef84672753" id="tgt1459" class="tgtSentence">für Bereiche, die an den Hintergrund der Visual Studio-Umgebung angepasst werden sollen.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1460" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="386e3c83b10fcafc41ef2b6aa5cacbe8" id="tgt1461" class="tgtSentence">als Füllung für Bereiche, die keine Hintergrundoberflächen sind\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="8fcb91d980717ec599e1fd616c8d00af" id="tgt1462" class="tgtSentence">als Hintergrund, auf dem Vordergrundelemente platziert werden sollen\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <table>
                    <thead>
                      <tr>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="700c216fb376666eaeda0c892e8bdc09" id="tgt1463" class="tgtSentence">Komponente\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="8e2dcfd7e7e24b1ca76c1193f645902b" id="tgt1464" class="tgtSentence">Element\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0b543509aafdb4a74686fb3c28516d75" id="tgt1465" class="tgtSentence">Tokenname: Category.color\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                      </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="772757f795df9a5287e8cf513c3398b6" id="tgt1466" class="tgtSentence">Untere Ebene\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d229bbf31eaeebc7c88897732d8b932d" id="tgt1467" class="tgtSentence">Hintergrund\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>

                          </para>

                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <TD rowspan="4">
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="b60968a0ce68eb6cfe33598a72ca6ac5" id="tgt1471" class="tgtSentence">Obere Ebene\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD rowspan="4">
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d229bbf31eaeebc7c88897732d8b932d" id="tgt1472" class="tgtSentence">Hintergrund\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                          <para>
                            <legacyItalic>
                              \<caps:sentence sentenceid="53a3e02fcc3667254c8e8a53611b1032" id="tgt1473" class="tgtSentence">Im hellen und dunklen Design von Visual Studio 2013 auf denselben Farbwert festgelegte Farbverlaufsstopps\</caps:sentence>
                            </legacyItalic>
                          </para>
                        </TD>

                            <codeInline>Environment.EnvironmentBackgroundGradientBegin</codeInline>
                          </para>
                        </TD>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="727f17dbc8904af660e2c389bfabf1b0" id="tgt1474" class="tgtSentence">Befehlsablage\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="699b0d133d68581cc4b2a389a26be5be" id="tgt1475" class="tgtSentence">Für die Hintergründe der Befehlsablage werden zwei Sätze von Tokennamen verwendet: einer für die Position der Menüleiste und der andere für die Position der Befehlsleisten.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d8cbf6d839eea7699347239b5525e3e0" id="tgt1476" class="tgtSentence"> Eine einzelne Befehlszeilengruppe verfügt über eigene Hintergrund-Farbwerte, die im Abschnitt "Befehlsleiste" ausführlicher erörtert werden.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="9dbb4517c3c0d96d1abf5b02a4ed6c18" id="tgt1477" class="tgtSentence"> Menü- und Befehlsleistentext wird in den entsprechenden Abschnitten zur Menü- und Befehlsleiste erörtert.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="00544c7d-a451-4b33-80ce-cc438e99f13a"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1478" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="34b67c2d331d9718438cf24fb4873369" id="tgt1479" class="tgtSentence">für Bereiche, in denen Menüs oder Symbolleisten platziert werden.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="5742aade9a7e5671b3c561677ec24e43" id="tgt1480" class="tgtSentence">bei Verwendung der richtigen Kombination aus Tokennamen für Hintergrund-/Vordergrundfarbe\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1481" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence sentenceid="3002e4b93c545fc5f32cec84f880793e" id="tgt1482" class="tgtSentence">für Bereiche, die keine Ähnlichkeit mit einer Befehlsablage aufweisen\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                  <table>
                    <thead>
                      <tr>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="700c216fb376666eaeda0c892e8bdc09" id="tgt1483" class="tgtSentence">Komponente\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="8e2dcfd7e7e24b1ca76c1193f645902b" id="tgt1484" class="tgtSentence">Element\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0b543509aafdb4a74686fb3c28516d75" id="tgt1485" class="tgtSentence">Tokenname: Category.color\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                      </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <TD rowspan="3">
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="3af448a8391c08f49dd3ef6959bfb8cc" id="tgt1486" class="tgtSentence">Menüleiste\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </TD>
                        <TD rowspan="3">
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence sentenceid="d229bbf31eaeebc7c88897732d8b932d" id="tgt1487" class="tgtSentence">Hintergrund\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                          <para>

          <section>
            <title>
              \<caps:sentence sentenceid="0e842b75e5f8473161ee799ef5a129fd" id="tgt1492" class="tgtSentence">Werkzeugkasten\</caps:sentence>
            </title>
            <content>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="47355cf54b8a610cae50e8be00b66898" id="tgt1493" class="tgtSentence">Der Werkzeugkasten ist eines der allgemeinen Toolfenster, die am häufigsten in Visual Studio verwendet werden.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence sentenceid="c724b353ef6c79535e4e9424b5b76138" id="tgt1494" class="tgtSentence"> Es handelt sich um ein Struktursteuerelement, auf das ein bestimmtes Design und ein bestimmter Stil angewendet wurde.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
              <mediaLink>
                \<image xlink:href="28d2a6f2-5ae8-45b1-9627-a2f300862592"></image>
              </mediaLink>
              <definitionTable>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="187d23d300800e3234b221e530e2e830" id="tgt1495" class="tgtSentence">Empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="92b65ae92ca388c80b25f8e14916c69c" id="tgt1496" class="tgtSentence">für den Entwurf eines Toolfensters, das immer mit dem Shell-Werkzeugkasten konsistent sein soll.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                </definition>
                <definedTerm>
                  \<caps:sentence sentenceid="09646dfd0aff9bab58e0a8415f0d15bf" id="tgt1497" class="tgtSentence">Nicht empfohlen...\</caps:sentence>
                </definedTerm>
                <definition>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence sentenceid="db8750c9b2238b87f26b4a6a3fe77b61" id="tgt1498" class="tgtSentence">für Elemente, die keine Ähnlichkeit mit der Werkzeugkasten-Benutzeroberfläche haben, oder wenn Sie nicht sicher sind, ob Ihre Benutzeroberfläche bei Änderung der Farben des Shell-Werkzeugkastens Probleme verursacht\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                </definition>
              </definitionTable>
              <para>
                <br />
              </para>
              <para>
                <legacyBold>

  \<caps:SxSSource locale="en-US">
    \<developerConceptualDocument xsi:schemaLocation="http://ddue.schemas.microsoft.com/authoring/2003/5 http://clixdevr3.blob.core.windows.net/ddueschema/developer.xsd" xmlns="http://ddue.schemas.microsoft.com/authoring/2003/5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <introduction>
        <para>
          \<caps:sentence id="src1" class="srcSentence">Insert introduction here.\</caps:sentence>
        </para>
      </introduction>
      <section>
        <title>
          \<caps:sentence id="src2" class="srcSentence">Shared colors\</caps:sentence>
        </title>
        <content>
          <para>
            \<caps:sentence id="src3" class="srcSentence">When you are designing UI that uses common Visual Studio shell elements, or you would like your interface element to be consistent with similar features, use existing token names in package definition files to choose and assign colors.\</caps:sentence>
            \<caps:sentence id="src4" class="srcSentence"> This ensures that your UI stays consistent with the overall Visual Studio environment and that it updates automatically when themes are added or updated.\</caps:sentence>
          </para>
          <para>
            \<caps:sentence id="src5" class="srcSentence">This article describes common UI elements and the token names that they use, which you can reference when building similar UI.\</caps:sentence>
            \<caps:sentence id="src6" class="srcSentence"> For specific information about how to access these color tokens, see \<link xlink:href="0e384ea1-4d9e-4307-8884-6e183900732c#BKMK_TheVSColorService">The VSColor Service</link>.\</caps:sentence>
          </para>
          <para>
            \<caps:sentence id="src7" class="srcSentence">Make sure to use token names correctly:\</caps:sentence>
          </para>
          <list class="bullet">
            <listItem>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence id="src8" class="srcSentence">
                  <legacyBold>Use token names based on function, not on the color itself.</legacyBold> The common shared colors are associated with specific interface elements and are only intended to be used for the same or similar features.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src9" class="srcSentence"> For example, don't reuse the color of a pressed combo box for a spinning progress animation just because you like the color.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src10" class="srcSentence"> The functions of the combo box and the animation are different, and if the color associated with the combo box changes, it may no longer be an appropriate color for your animation element.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src11" class="srcSentence"> Consistent use of color helps orient your users and prevent confusion.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
            </listItem>
            <listItem>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence id="src12" class="srcSentence">
                  <legacyBold>Use background and text colors in the correct combination.</legacyBold> Background colors that are intended to be used with text will have an associated text color.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src13" class="srcSentence"> Don't use text colors other than what is specified for that background.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src14" class="srcSentence"> If there is not an associated text color, don't use that background color for any surface on which you expect to display text.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src15" class="srcSentence"> Other combinations of text and background colors may result in an unreadable interface.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
            </listItem>
            <listItem>
              <para>
                \<caps:sentence id="src16" class="srcSentence">
                  <legacyBold>Use control colors that are appropriate for their location.</legacyBold> In certain states, some Visual Studio controls do not have separate border and background colors.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src17" class="srcSentence"> Instead, they pick up those colors from the surfaces behind them.\</caps:sentence>
                \<caps:sentence id="src18" class="srcSentence"> Make sure that you always use the token names that are appropriate for the location where you are placing the control.\</caps:sentence>
              </para>
            </listItem>
          </list>
          <alert class="important">
            <para>
              \<caps:sentence id="src19" class="srcSentence">Do not use tokens found in the categories "Start Page" or "Cider"!\</caps:sentence>
            </para>
          </alert>
        </content>
        <sections>
          <section>
            <title>
              \<caps:sentence id="src20" class="srcSentence">Command structures\</caps:sentence>
            </title>
            <content>
              <para></para>
            </content>
            <sections>
              <section address="BKMK_CommandMenus">
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence id="src21" class="srcSentence">Menus\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src22" class="srcSentence">Menus can occur at several places within Visual Studio 2013: the main menu bar, embedded in document or tool windows, or on right-click in various locations throughout the IDE.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src23" class="srcSentence"> Implementations of menus associated with other UI elements are discussed in the section for the respective element.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src24" class="srcSentence"> You should always use the standard menu implementation provided by the Visual Studio environment.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src25" class="srcSentence"> However, in some rare instances you might not have access to the standard Visual Studio menus.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src26" class="srcSentence"> In these situations, use the following token names to ensure that your UI is consistent with other menus in Visual Studio.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="1f731e6e-4998-436b-81ca-8cd22a79779f"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src27" class="srcSentence">Use …\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src28" class="srcSentence">whenever you need to create a custom menu.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src29" class="srcSentence">when you have a new UI component that you want to match the Visual Studio menus.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src30" class="srcSentence">Do not use …\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src31" class="srcSentence">the background color alone.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src32" class="srcSentence"> Always use the background/foreground combination as specified.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                </content>
                <sections>
                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src33" class="srcSentence">Menu title\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src34" class="srcSentence">Menu titles consist of a background, a border, and the title text, as well as an optional glyph, usually when the menu is found in a command bar.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="a15009c7-a479-4269-9b23-cd93d9cb3fa9"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src35" class="srcSentence">Use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src36" class="srcSentence">whenever you are creating a custom menu title.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src37" class="srcSentence">Do not use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src38" class="srcSentence">for anything that you don't want to always match the menu title.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src39" class="srcSentence">in any background/foreground combination other than specified.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>

                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src86" class="srcSentence">Menu\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src87" class="srcSentence">An individual menu item consists of the menu text and an optional icon, check box, or submenu glyph.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src88" class="srcSentence"> Its background and text color change on hover.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src89" class="srcSentence"> This color token is a background/foreground pair.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="a2316d28-15ae-42fb-91e2-f6c4d1d63c79"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src90" class="srcSentence">Use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src91" class="srcSentence">for any drop-down list that is launched from a menu bar or command bar.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src92" class="srcSentence">Do not use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src93" class="srcSentence">for any drop-down list that occurs in another context.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src94" class="srcSentence">in any background/foreground combination other than specified.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>

                      </para>

              <section>
                <title>
                  \<caps:sentence id="src138" class="srcSentence">Command bar\</caps:sentence>
                </title>
                <content>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src139" class="srcSentence">The command bar can appear in multiple places within the Visual Studio IDE, most notably the command shelf and embedded in tool or document windows.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <para>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src140" class="srcSentence">In general, always use the standard command bar implementation provided by the Visual Studio environment.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src141" class="srcSentence"> Using the standard mechanism ensures that all visual details will appear correctly and that interactive elements, will behave consistently with other Visual Studio command bar controls.\</caps:sentence>
                    \<caps:sentence id="src142" class="srcSentence"> However, if it is necessary for you to build your own command bar, make sure you style it correctly using the following token names.\</caps:sentence>
                  </para>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="41a8160b-d0d7-48df-82f6-fef85b070838"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <mediaLink>
                    \<image xlink:href="e031c0e0-f1cd-4e6b-8a7a-c83af7791187"></image>
                  </mediaLink>
                  <definitionTable>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src143" class="srcSentence">Use…\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src144" class="srcSentence">in places where you need an embedded command bar but are unable to use the standard Visual Studio command bar implementation.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                    </definition>
                    <definedTerm>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src145" class="srcSentence">Do not use…\</caps:sentence>
                    </definedTerm>
                    <definition>
                      <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src146" class="srcSentence">for UI elements that are not similar to a command bar.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src147" class="srcSentence">for command bar components other than the ones for which token names are specified.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </listItem>
                      </list>
                    </definition>
                  </definitionTable>
                </content>
                <sections>
                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src148" class="srcSentence">Command bar group\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src149" class="srcSentence">A command bar group consists of a related set of command bar controls and might contain any number of buttons, split buttons, drop-down menus, combo boxes, or menus.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src150" class="srcSentence"> Colors for those controls are regulated by separate token names and are discussed individually elsewhere in this guide.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src151" class="srcSentence"> A separator line is used to divide a command bar group into related subgroups.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="bf2531e5-4387-41ef-a7db-49bf7089e132"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src152" class="srcSentence">Use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src153" class="srcSentence">in places where you need an embedded command bar but are unable to use the standard Visual Studio command bar implementation.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src154" class="srcSentence">Do not use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src155" class="srcSentence">for UI elements that are not similar to a command bar.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src156" class="srcSentence">for command bar components other than the ones for which token names are specified.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src157" class="srcSentence">
                          <legacyBold>Default</legacyBold> (no other states)\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <table>
                        <thead>
                          <tr>
                            <TD>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src158" class="srcSentence">Element\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </TD>
                            <TD>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src159" class="srcSentence">Token name: Category.color\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                          <tr>
                            <TD>
                              <para>

                              </para>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src161" class="srcSentence">While not used in modern themed UI, there are gradient stops and values for this background.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                          <tr>
                            <TD>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src162" class="srcSentence">Border\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </TD>
                            <TD>

                                <codeInline>Environment.CommandBarToolBarBorder</codeInline>
                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                          <tr>

                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                          <tr>

                              </para>
                            </TD>
                          </tr>
                        </tbody>
                      </table>
                    </content>
                  </section>
                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src165" class="srcSentence">Command icons\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        <mediaLinkInline>
                          \<image xlink:href="5bf7c2f7-1b5b-46f1-a0a7-99c765e312d7"></image>
                        </mediaLinkInline>
                      </para>
                      <para>
                        <mediaLinkInline>
                          \<image xlink:href="2ca75069-93b6-48ed-99be-41a8cf8a1e8d"></image>
                        </mediaLinkInline>
                      </para>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src166" class="srcSentence">Use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src167" class="srcSentence">for any buttons that will be placed on a command bar.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src168" class="srcSentence">Do not use…\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src169" class="srcSentence">for controls that have their own token names.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src170" class="srcSentence">in any background/foreground combination other than specified.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>
                      <para>
                        <legacyBold>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src171" class="srcSentence">Default\</caps:sentence>
                        </legacyBold>
                      </para>

                  <section address="BKMK_CommandComboBox">
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src217" class="srcSentence">Combo box\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <alert class="important">
                        <para>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src218" class="srcSentence">Combo boxes are similar to drop-downs, but include an editable text region.\</caps:sentence>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src219" class="srcSentence"> If your drop-down does not include an editable text region, use the color tokens found under \<link xlink:href="9d3186f3-07d2-441f-b33e-435e95d8a0b8#BKMK_CommandDropDown">Drop-down</link>.\</caps:sentence>
                        </para>
                      </alert>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="810a31ac-9e29-4b83-8ea3-94f21857a001"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src220" class="srcSentence">Use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src221" class="srcSentence">when building custom combo boxes.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src222" class="srcSentence">when creating a command bar control that is similar to a combo box.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src223" class="srcSentence">Do not use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src224" class="srcSentence">for anything you don’t want always to match the command bar UI.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src225" class="srcSentence">when you have access to a styled combo box.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>

                  <section address="BKMK_CommandDropDown">
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src297" class="srcSentence">Drop-down\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <alert class="important">
                        <para>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src298" class="srcSentence">Drop-downs are similar to combo boxes, but lack editable text regions.\</caps:sentence>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src299" class="srcSentence"> If your drop-down includes an editable text region, use the color tokens found under \<link xlink:href="9d3186f3-07d2-441f-b33e-435e95d8a0b8#BKMK_CommandComboBox">Combo box</link>.\</caps:sentence>
                        </para>
                      </alert>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="c9cffbc0-1de3-47ce-b073-c4ed73782066"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src300" class="srcSentence">Use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src301" class="srcSentence">when you are creating custom drop-down list controls.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src302" class="srcSentence">Do not use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src303" class="srcSentence">for anything that is not similar to a drop-down list.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src304" class="srcSentence">for combo boxes or split buttons.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>

                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src366" class="srcSentence">Split button\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src367" class="srcSentence">Split buttons share many token names with other command bar controls, such as buttons, menus, and command bar text.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src368" class="srcSentence"> All necessary action and drop-down button token names are repeated here for convenience.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src369" class="srcSentence"> Split button drop-down lists are implementations of command bar \<link xlink:href="9d3186f3-07d2-441f-b33e-435e95d8a0b8#BKMK_CommandMenus">Menus</link>.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="4693df80-f61c-42ae-9182-332725626817"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src370" class="srcSentence">Use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src371" class="srcSentence">when you are building a custom split button.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src372" class="srcSentence">Do not use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <list class="bullet">
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src373" class="srcSentence">for other kinds of buttons.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                            <listItem>
                              <para>
                                \<caps:sentence id="src374" class="srcSentence">in any background/foreground combination other than specified.\</caps:sentence>
                              </para>
                            </listItem>
                          </list>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>

                  <section>
                    <title>
                      \<caps:sentence id="src424" class="srcSentence">‘More options’ and ‘Overflow’ buttons\</caps:sentence>
                    </title>
                    <content>
                      <para>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src425" class="srcSentence">The "More options" button is used when a command bar group is customizable by either adding or removing related command bar buttons.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src426" class="srcSentence"> The "Overflow" button appears when a command bar is truncated due to lack of horizontal space, and on click shows a menu containing the command bar buttons that cannot be displayed.\</caps:sentence>
                        \<caps:sentence id="src427" class="srcSentence"> Colors for these two buttons are controlled by the same set of token names.\</caps:sentence>
                      </para>
                      <mediaLink>
                        \<image xlink:href="b573d78e-7647-4b39-917b-95656c6306f9"></image>
                      </mediaLink>
                      <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src428" class="srcSentence">Use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src429" class="srcSentence">for custom 'More options' or 'Overflow' buttons.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                          \<caps:sentence id="src430" class="srcSentence">Do not use …\</caps:sentence>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                          <para>
                            \<caps:sentence id="src431" class="srcSentence">for buttons that don't have similar functionality to a 'More options' or 'Overflow' button.\</caps:sentence>
                          </para>
                        </definition>
                      </definitionTable>
                      <para>
                        <br />
                      </para>
                      <para>
                        <legacyBold>
